resources.string:
Copyright (C) 2012- CodeUnited 

Kulturarv (Cultural Heritage) is an open source augmented reality app guiding you through Denmarks protected and preservation-worthy buildings. The app was developed in a cooperation between CodeUnited and Dansk Kulturstyrelsen (Danish Agency for Culture). The usage of logos and other artifacts of the agency, including the "Fredede og bevaringsværdige bygninger" (FBB) web-service, are protected by the agreement between CodeUnited and Kulturstyrelsen. 

 

All the trademarks, product names, company names and logos mentioned, displayed, cited or otherwise indicated on this application are the property of their respective owners. Kulturarv uses the open services (API) provided by Wikipedia, Instagram Inc., Flickr, and Twitter and is not endorsed or certified by any of aforementioned companies. 

 

Kulturarv logo uses the icon Institution designed by Thibault Geffroy from The Noun Project. 

 

Kulturarv is an open source project. Feel free to download the source code from http://code.google.com/p/kulturarv/. The app is released under the GNU GPL v3 license, find its details below. 

 

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or at your option) any later version. 

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. 

 You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>
Sorry, a connection Error occured! \nPlease check if you are connected to the Internet.
The GPS location can not be updated... \nIf you continue it could be that the Information \nwill not be displayed in the right place.
Sorry, there is no further \ninformation available.
Location not found, make sure you enabled Wifi location or GPS in the settings.
Show only the most interesting objects. Results in better performance.
Show only the buildings that match the maximum value requirement. Lower number means higher cultural value.
The info box on the upper right corner shows the latest location and its fix time.
When checked, every markers (refresh, or received from specific data source) data update is rendered on screen.
Log application activity to file. Warning: leave it unchecked unless you know what you\'re doing.
Data connection is required for running Kulturarv. Enable either data or wifi and restart the app.
Enable GPS for a better experience with the app
Building value must be between 1 and 9.
None of the location providers (network, gps) are enabled. Switch on at least one of them and restart the app.
Maximum objects count cannot be changed for this data source
Use a valid positive integer greater than 0
Compass data unreliable. Please recalibrate compass.
Max objects should be less than or equal
